Abstrak:
Tree structure is one of natural optimal transport network. It has also been shown by diferent formulation that optimal transport networks take tree-like structure. By using construction material as minimum as possible, a tree does not just simply span its branches to provide an ability to capture maximum light, but also it has to be mechanically stable. Based on the Gilbert-Steiner optimum network problem, we constructed a growing tree model to characterize the self-similarity of branching network in tree. A non-growing model based on random walkis also constructed as a comparison to the growing model. By considering three diferent value of      , it is shown that the growing tree structure exhibit diferent pattern at diferent range of which are 0  1. Self-similarity is observed at 0  1, the average length of branch is found to be unusual. By the comparison, which is very dificult for 0 < 
< 1 and           
> 1, it is shown that at = 1, there is no qualitative difierent between the growing model and the non-growing model..
